comments.text:
User Agent: Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 6.0; U; en) Presto/2.9.168 Version/11.50

Steps to reproduce:

This has been an issue on all versions of Thunderbird, emails that come through with inline images of mime-type image/x-citrix-jpeg do not get displayed.  I understand this is because the mime-type is non-standard, still it would be nice if there was a configuration option to set which mime types thunderbird will display inline in the images.

On versions previous to 5.0, the images showed in the attachments and you at least had the option to download and view the attachment with an external editor.  In 5.0 this option is not available, so there is no possible option to view the images.

Note, this issue happens for me for every email I receive from clients who uses citrix.


Actual results:

Unable to view image inline, and no option to download the inline attachment and view in external application in Thunderbird 5.0.


Expected results:

either
- Allow image to be displayed inline, either directly, or via a configuration option
- Allow inline attachment to be downloaded so that it can be displayed via an external application.

comments.text:
There is nothing special with the images, they are just standard jpeg images, so yes, if I save them externally and open in Firefox they display.  (Which is difficult to do in Thunderbird 5.0 as it doesn't give the option to open the images as attachments at all).

Note, the issue is Thunderbird is ignoring them based on the mime type in the email.  For example if I save one of the affected emails, open it a text editor and replace the following lines:

Content-Type: image/x-citrix-jpeg;
	name="image003.jpg"

with

Content-Type: image/jpeg;
	name="image003.jpg"

and then reopen the email in Thunderbird the images will display.

comments.text: Recently upgraded from SeaMonkey 2.0.14 to Seamonkey 2.3.1. on several computers and now have a problem with this bug. When receiving an inline image of the image/x-citrix-jpeg type the image does not display. Also the attachment pane is not visible so the image cannot even be saved and viewed from the desktop or other folder. In SeaMonkey 2.0.14 the attachment window was visible when receiving this type of image so we were able to save the .jpg file and open it with an external application. Is there something that I could change in about:config as a workaround until this bug gets resolved?
